title: Industrial Heritage & Digital Art
subTitle: 工業遺產與數位藝術：港區美學一日遊
intro: Experience how Kaohsiung transformed abandoned warehouses and active port areas into contemporary art spaces. This route is the most convenient for transportation and perfect for social media photography.
transportation: Take the **KMRT (Red/Orange Line)** and transfer to the **LRT (Light Rail)**. Highly recommended to use an electronic ticket (EasyCard/iPass).

spots.name: Formosa Boulevard Station (捷運美麗島站)
spots.description: Start at the 'Dome of Light', the world's largest public art installation made of individual pieces of colored glass.

spots.name: The Pier-2 Art Center (駁二藝術特區)
spots.address: Dayi St., Yancheng District, Kaohsiung City
spots.description: Walk through the Dayi Warehouse cluster to see boutique shops and digital art galleries housed in renovated old sugar warehouses.

spots.name: Great Harbor Bridge (大港橋)
spots.description: Wait for the 3 PM rotation show! It is the longest horizontal swing bridge in Asia, connecting Pier-2 with the Penglai Commercial Port area.

spots.name: Kaohsiung Port Cruise Terminal (高雄港埠旅運中心)
spots.description: Check out the iconic 3D Whale Wall and the futuristic architecture resembling waves, a new landmark for international cruises.

spots.name: KW2 (棧貳庫)
spots.description: Enjoy dinner at this historic warehouse turned waterfront complex. Don't miss the pure white carousel with the sunset backdrop.

title: Oriental Mysteries & Military Village Life
subTitle: 東方祕境與眷村日常：歷史層次之旅
intro: From the religious mythos of Lotus Pond to the unique circular architecture of military communities, this route offers the strongest sense of historical layering in Taiwan.
transportation: Take KMRT to **Zuoying Station**, then use buses or **YouBike 2.0** for short distances.

spots.name: Dragon and Tiger Pagodas (蓮池潭龍虎塔)
spots.description: Enter through the Dragon's mouth and exit through the Tiger's to turn bad luck into good. (Note: Renovation completed in 2025).

spots.name: Confucius Temple (左營孔廟)
spots.description: The largest Confucius Temple in Taiwan, showcasing majestic Song Dynasty architectural style and a peaceful atmosphere.

spots.name: Guomao Community (果貿社區)
spots.description: Nicknamed 'Little Hong Kong' for its dense, circular apartment buildings. It preserves the nostalgic atmosphere and food of old military dependents' villages.

spots.name: Shoushan LOVE Lookout (壽山LOVE觀景台)
spots.description: The ultimate spot to witness the sparkling night views of the entire Kaohsiung city and harbor from above.

title: Urban Lifestyle & Healing Farms
subTitle: 南國都會與療癒農場：親子二日遊
intro: Transition from 'Hardcore Industry' to 'Healing Economy'. This journey is specially designed for families, featuring art, shopping, and animal interactions.
transportation: Day 1: LRT & Walk. Day 2: KMRT to **Gangshan South** + Taxi/Charter.

spots.name: LRT Totoro Tunnel (輕軌龍貓隧道)
spots.description: Ride the Light Rail through the 'Museum of Fine Arts' station section, where trees form a green tunnel resembling scenes from Studio Ghibli.

spots.name: Neiwei Arts Center (內惟藝術中心)
spots.description: A sleek, white lifestyle-oriented art space that blends cinema, dining, and reading. Perfect for a relaxing afternoon.

spots.name: Dream Mall (夢時代購物中心)
spots.description: Kaohsiung's premier shopping destination and the main venue for the New Year's Eve countdown. Enjoy dinner and the rooftop Ferris wheel.

spots.name: Kaohsiung Interactive Farm (嘎逼＆牛奶互動園區)
spots.description: Get up close with adorable capybaras and alpacas in this popular healing farm.

spots.name: Siaogangshan Skywalk Park (崗山之眼)
spots.description: Walk along the violin-shaped skybridge for a panoramic view of the Agongdian Reservoir and the plains below.

title: Showa Romance & Old Town Lights
subTitle: 昭和浪漫與老城光影：文青深度行
intro: Explore the exquisite aesthetics of Japanese colonial villas and the woven history of Fengshan's ancient Qing Dynasty walls.

spots.name: Syo-yo-en (逍遙園)
spots.description: The restored historic villa of Kozui Otani, featuring rare architectural styles from the Showa era with a distinct green ambiance.

spots.name: Sanfeng Temple (三鳳宮)
spots.description: Famous for its sea of red lanterns, offering a spectacular visual experience and a great photo spot.

spots.name: Fengshan Festival of Light (鳳山光之季)
spots.description: A seasonal winter event (Dec-Feb) lighting up the old city canals and Dadong Wetlands Park with beautiful lanterns.

spots.name: Weiwuying Center for the Arts (衛武營)
spots.description: The world's largest single-roof performing arts center. Its undulating structure is inspired by banyan trees.

title: Mountains, Sea, Buddha & City
subTitle: 山海佛城全覽：國際旅客首選
intro: Combining world-class landmarks, religious wonders, and lunar-like geological landscapes, this route shows the diverse depth of Kaohsiung.
transportation: City MRT + **Chartered Car** for Day 2 (Fo Guang Shan & Moon World).

spots.name: Cijin Island (旗津)
spots.description: Take a ferry to this narrow island. Visit the Rainbow Church, eat fresh seafood, and watch the sunset from the Cihou Lighthouse.

spots.name: Fo Guang Shan Buddha Museum (佛光山佛陀紀念館)
spots.description: A magnificent Buddhist complex featuring a giant bronze Big Buddha and eight monumental pagodas. A place of peace and grandeur.

spots.name: Tianliao Moon World (田寮月世界)
spots.description: Witness the surreal badland topography that resembles the surface of the moon, created by crustal movement and erosion.

spots.name: SKM Park (草衙道賽車樂園)
spots.description: An outlet mall with the world's only authorized overseas Suzuka Circuit karting track. Great for a thrilling finish to your trip.

title: Wildlife & Indigenous Aesthetics
subTitle: 南台灣野生與原民美學：山海共榮
intro: Emphasizing the harmony of mountains and sea. Discover the limestone trails of Shoushan and the stone-slab houses of the Maolin tribes.
transportation: Hiking gear recommended. **Car rental** is essential for Maolin (Day 2).

spots.name: Shoushan National Nature Park (壽山國家自然公園)
spots.description: Hike through limestone caves and observe Formosan Macaques in their natural habitat. (Remember: Do not feed the monkeys!).

spots.name: Maolin National Scenic Area (茂林國家風景區)
spots.description: Famous for the purple crow butterflies (winter) and the Dragon Head Mountain trail.

spots.name: Dona Tribe (多納部落)
spots.description: One of the best-preserved Rukai indigenous villages featuring traditional stone-slab houses.

spots.name: Ruifeng Night Market (瑞豐夜市)
spots.description: The locals' favorite night market. Try the Angel Chicken Cutlet and various creative street snacks.
